subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usual ghost hunter stuff.
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_015A_01C9BDE1.8D0E5DB0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I agree. And I think that this is no mistake. I believe there are things th=
at are beyond human ability to grasp and study and it is meant to be that w=
ay. We are allowed glimpses, but just enough to give us a taste.

For me, i=
t is the thrill of the chase.

April

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  Fro=
m: Frank Sumption 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, April =
15, 2009 3:37 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: An alternative to the usual g=
host hunter stuff.






   It's the same with the voices, I judge the mess=
age by content, and personal meaning, I haven't seen anything paranormal th=
at operates any different. I think it's for the individual, mostly. That's =
why all these tests seem to fail. You get enough to interest others, but ne=
ver proof, at least not proof that's accepted by the scientists. 



   Fra=
nk-S


  On Wed, Apr 15, 2009 at 2:24 PM, Rick <rasterer@...> wrote:
=





    Anyone have any luck with this calibration experiment?

    (Note =
this experiment isn't for anyone who just likes to play around with their b=
oard, and doesn't really care to know its accuracy. This is for those inter=
ested in determining how well their board approach works).

    --- In EVP-=
ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Rick" <rasterer@...> wrote:
    >
    > If anyone fee=
ls like calibrating their board, or wants to know if they can get accurate =
information from it, I have written down a number between 1 and a billion (=
1,000,000,000)
    > 
    > Let me know what your board thinks it is. 
    =
> If it gets it correct, sounds like you've got something important going o=
n there!
    > 
    > If it can't get it correct, I suppose that brings int=
o suspect all its other answers.
    > 
    > 
    > 
    > 
    > 
    > -=
-- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "threadsintyme@" <Threadsintyme@> wrote:
   =
 > >
    > > Hi Lori,
    > > Glad that you brought this up! A true medium =
can give you a lot of the details that Ouija boards can't. They can also gi=
ve you complete names, dates, info that is totally unknown to others (excep=
t for those directly involved). 
    > > There are some excellent readings =
on YouTube and I don't mean the crappy ones...I forgot what this one guy's =
name was (he is in spirit now) but he could tel you details!! I almost my s=
kin chill...
    > > I will see if I can locate some of those highly respec=
ted members of Spiritualism and will post those here for all of you to watc=
h.
    > > Blessings,
    > > Al
    > > 
    > > ---------- Original Messa=
ge ----------

    > > 
    > > You forgot yawn=
 from boredom, that's what I do.
    > > 
    > > Use it, don't use it. I d=
on't care. But why bother. When people ask me I usually suggest that if the=
y want to communicate with ... whatever why not develop the ability yoursel=
f. - ya, I'm one of those who believe anyone can.
    > > 
    > > There's =
always the question in the back of your mind whether your partner's moving =
it. The intentions of "what" you are talking to. Not to mention it's too sl=
ow and limited.
    > > 
    > > Besides if you take the time to develop th=
e ability you can get more texture in the information. Asking the board "wh=
ere you married?" may get you a "yes" but a psychic might get the sense of =
a religious or civil ceremonhy, the garment(s) worn, other's in the party, =
or whether that Being approved/disapproved of their spouse (ie was it a rel=
uctant union).
    > > 
    > > ~Lori
    > > 
    > > "My life is boring, =
my fantasies are a theme park." --Anne Rice Responding to an interviewer wh=
o just did not get it.
